intro: Stenostephanus aglaus, commonly known as the African violet, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is native to tropical Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to white. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and prefers well-draining soil. It is widely cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care. Stenostephanus aglaus thrives in warm temperatures and requires moderate light to flourish.
